pageDescription: Our event is dedicated to providing a harassment-free and inclusive experience for everyone, regardless of background or identity

introduction.title: Our Commitment
paragraphs: Hack The Breach is committed to creating a safe, professional, and collaborative online environment for all participants. As this event takes place virtually via Google Meet, we have developed specific guidelines to ensure everyone can participate fully and comfortably.

By participating in Hack The Breach, you agree to abide by this Code of Conduct in all event spaces, including video calls, chat channels, collaborative platforms, and social media discussions related to the event.

rules.title: Respectful Communication
items: Use welcoming and inclusive language
Respect differing viewpoints and experiences
Accept constructive criticism gracefully
Focus on what's best for the community and event
Show empathy towards other participants
Use appropriate language in chat and verbal discussions

rules.title: Online Environment Guidelines
items: Keep your camera on during workshops when possible
Mute your microphone when not speaking
Use the "raise hand" feature to ask questions
Respect speakers by avoiding interruptions
Keep chat discussions relevant to the current topic
Do not share meeting links with unauthorized individuals

rules.title: Prohibited Behavior
items: Harassment, intimidation, or discrimination in any form
Inappropriate screen sharing or background content
Disruptive use of video, audio, or chat features
Offensive comments related to gender, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, race, or religion
Posting or threatening to post personally identifying information ("doxing")
Unauthorized recording or screenshots of participants
Any illegal activity or encouragement of illegal activity
Sustained disruption of talks or other events

rules.title: Hackathon-Specific Rules
items: Only attack designated infrastructure and challenge environments
Do not attempt to disrupt other teams or attack their systems
Report any vulnerabilities in the platform to organizers immediately
Do not share flags or solutions during the competition
Follow fair play principles - no cheating or exploiting loopholes
Respect time limits and submission deadlines

rules.title: Privacy & Data Protection
items: Respect the privacy of all participants
Do not share or collect personal information of other participants
Get explicit permission before sharing screenshots that include others
Keep breakout room discussions confidential when requested
Follow appropriate data handling practices in the hackathon

reporting.title: Reporting Violations
reporting.description: If you experience or witness behavior that violates our Code of Conduct, please report it immediately:

methods.name: Direct Message
methods.details: Contact any staff member in the Google Meet chat with a private message

methods.name: Reporting Form
methods.details: Submit through our anonymous reporting form

reporting.note: All reports will be handled with discretion and confidentiality. We are committed to responding promptly to any concerns and taking appropriate action.

enforcement.title: Enforcement
paragraphs: Participants asked to stop any harassing or disruptive behavior are expected to comply immediately.
If a participant engages in behavior that violates this Code of Conduct, the organizers may take any action they deem appropriate, including:
consequences: Issuing a verbal or written warning
Temporary muting or removal from specific sessions
Expulsion from the entire event without refund
Reporting to relevant authorities if appropriate
